body:
I believe this is due to us not drawing the entire background in a single pass. When the first glyph cache gets filled up, Alacritty starts batching draw calls by texture. This is supported by what you've described

> occur most often after displaying a lot of characters

and

> Restarting alacritty fixes it

I'm updating the title to reflect the required action here.

rename.from: Right half of double width characters sometimes missing
rename.to: Glyphs sometimes cut off (need to draw background in single pass)

issue.title: Colored emojis on Linux/BSD with freetype.
issue.body:
This PR implements colored emojis support on Linux/BSD with freetype.

The Linux/BSD part of it is working fine, however the implementation requires some discussion, since integration is not that simple in the current structure and I don't want to tight the other platforms on how Linux/BSD operates here.


![picture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27620401/69481137-810b5500-0e1f-11ea-8c39-2b0a8e5a44b6.png)


~P.s. I'll fix macOS/Windows builds when we agree on integration.~

issue.title: Chinese characters occasionally have an issue in neovim.
issue.body:
### System

OS: Linux/BSD/macOS/Windows
Version: 0.4.2
Linux/BSD: X11, GNOME

There is a very strange phenomenon. After neovim is used for a period of time, the Chinese characters will appear as shown below:
![2020-04-04_04-54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17562139/78413938-5098ba80-764c-11ea-9f5e-17e25952d0f9.png)

It doesn't happen  with 100% probability.

It runs inside tmux. When I reset alacritty and attach it to tmux, everything works fine as expect.

This has never happened in the gnome-terminal.

issue.title: Sometimes cjk character can only see the left half
issue.body: Sometimes the cjk character and the spacer after it are assigned to a different texture atlas, resulting in only the left half of the character being drawn. The chinese character is drawn as ### System OS: macOS Version: alacritty 0.6.0-dev (dd32447) ### Logs ``` [2020-07-27 08:41:02.638338000] [DEBUG] Using environment locale: en_US.UTF-8/UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8/en_US.U TF-8 [2020-07-27 08:41:02.646170000] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty [2020-07-27 08:41:02.646357000] [INFO] Configuration loaded from "/Users/flw/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml" [2020-07-27 08:41:02.767907000] [DEBUG] Estimated DPR: 2 [2020-07-27 08:41:02.767989000] [DEBUG] Estimated Cell Size: 21 x 45 [2020-07-27 08:41:02.768034000] [DEBUG] Estimated Dimensions: None [2020-07-27 08:41:02.958046000] [INFO] Device pixel ratio: 2 [2020-07-27 08:41:02.961405000] [INFO] Initializing glyph cache... [2020-07-27 08:41:03.041121000] [INFO] ... finished initializing glyph cache in 0.079594508s [2020-07-27 08:41:03.041218000] [INFO] Cell Size: 21 x 45 [2020-07-27 08:41:03.041248000] [INFO] Padding: 0 x 0 [2020-07-27 08:41:03.041280000] [INFO] Width: 1600, Height: 1200 [2020-07-27 08:41:03.043164000] [INFO] PTY dimensions: Line(26) x Column(76) [2020-07-27 08:41:03.055212000] [INFO] Initialisation complete [2020-07-27 08:41:03.557021000] [DEBUG] New num_cols is 121 and num_lines is 35 [2020-07-27 08:41:03.573908000] [INFO] Width: 2560, Height: 1600 ```

issue.title: Render wide characters correctly to avoid being cut off
issue.body:
The commit contains a realistically tested workaround with no performance impact.

I made a few necessary changes to the shaders in the GLSL code, fixing the
background width of the wide characters and skipping everything about spacer
handling (in fact, they shouldn't be displayed on the screen at all, either
foreground or background).

This should close #791, cc #4038.

issue.title: Fix wide characters being cut off
